title: What do all Gamelan instruments have in common? - Quora

response.answer_text: A gamelan is a traditional ensemble performing the music of Java and Bali. It is composed primarily of percussion instruments, but there are wind and string instruments as well, so technically the only things that the instruments have in common is that they produce sound and are used to perform gamelan music. The music is predominantly pentatonic, although there are also seven note scales in use. Here are some links for further study: Gamelan - Wikipedia Balinese Gamelan Rhythms
